text: The 2017–18 CEV Champions League was the highest level of European club volleyball in the season and the 59th edition. ==Qualification== The 12 teams of participants on the basis of ranking list for European Cup Competitions and 8 teams qualify from the qualification rounds. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" !Rank!!Country !!Vacancies!!Qualified teams |- |align="center" rowspan="2"|1||rowspan="2"|||align="center" rowspan="2"|2||Zenit Kazan |- |Dinamo Moscow |- |align="center" rowspan="2"|2||rowspan="2"|||align="center" rowspan="2"|2||Cucine Lube Civitanova |- Kononov, Valentin Krotkov, Ivan Demakov, Alexander Butko, Alexey Samoylenko, Alexander Gutsalyuk, Alexey Verbov, Maxim Mikhaylov |- |Head Coach |- |Vladimir Alekno |} ==Awards== *Most Valuable Player : Maxim Mikhaylov (Zenit Kazan) *Best Setter : Alexander Butko (Zenit Kazan) *Best Outside Spikers : Osmany Juantorena (Cucine Lube Civitanova) : Wilfredo León (Zenit Kazan) *Best Middle Blockers : Dragan Stanković (Cucine Lube Civitanova) : Marko Podraščanin (Sir Colussi Sicoma Perugia) *Best Opposite Spiker : Tsvetan Sokolov (Cucine Lube Civitanova) *Best Libero : Jenia Grebennikov (Cucine
